subject: Re: [junit] Can we test servlets in Junit ?
msgSnippet: +1 for Michael Feathers book. My own approach to testing servlets is still evolving and it depends on the complexity of what you are trying to manage.
messageBody:
+1 for Michael Feathers book.

My own approach to testing servlets is still evolving and it depends on the
complexity of what you are trying to manage. Initially, you might be happy
just to use empty implementations of HttpServletRequest and
HttpServletResponse, and use subclasses of the empty implementation to
provide contextual assistance in each test. As you progress, you might find
more mileage in using a mock objects approach, using something like
mockobjects.com, jmock or rmock.

James

On 11/01/06, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Maru,
>
> JUnit can certainly be used to write tests for maintenance projects. An
> excellent book for thinking about this situation is Working Effectively
> with Legacy Code, by Michael Feathers. It's been a long time since I've
> tested servlets, so I hope that the other group members may be able to
> help you there. Good luck,
>
> David Saff
>
> Maruthi Kusoji wrote:
>
> > Hi all,
> >
> > I am new to this Junit I know very little.
> > I work in a maintenance project. I want to know if junit can be used
> > to generate the test cases for a maintenace project which is already
> > developed one.
> >
> > If yes, How can we test servlets and track a servlet through its
> > life cycle using Junit?
> >
> > Is it mandatory that Junit should be used only for a project which
> > is developed from the scratch?
> >
> > Thanks,
> > Maru
> >
